summary: SummaryDior La Mousse OFF/ON Foaming Cleanser with niacinamide that removes impurities, makeup and sunscreen residue revealing clean, hydrated and luminous skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsTake OFF 99% of microparticles and excess sebum; leave ON hydration and soothe skin discomfort.La Mousse OFF/ON Foaming Cleanser transforms from a luxurious cream to a rich, airy foam with a subtle fresh scent.This hydrating cleanser hydrates and smooths skin, and visibly tightens pores.Research ResultsClinically proven OFF/ON effectiveness under dermatological control:OFF EFFECTIVENESS - Eliminates impurities, makeup and sunscreen residue - Eliminates 99% of microparticles on the skin’s surface¹ - Reduces excess sebum and maintains skin’s natural pH - Halves deep skin damage caused by pollution²ON EFFECTIVENESS - Helps maintain the skin barrier for 24 hours³ - Hydrates skin for 6 hours³ - Visibly tightens pores - Soothes feelings of skin discomfortAfter 1 month, skin is 42% smoother⁴ and appears more luminous.¹Instrumental test on 30 women, tested on 1 µm, 20–25 µm, 49 µm.²Ex vivo test.³Instrumental test on 30 women.⁴Clinical tests on 40 people after 1 month of use.Item 2639711How To UseTake a small amount of La Mousse OFF/ON Foaming Cleanser. Add water and lather into a foam in the palm of your hand.Apply to your face using circular motions.Rinse thoroughly with water, then dry your skin with a clean towel.In the event of contact with eyes, rinse immediately with water.IngredientsAqua (Water), Myristic Acid, Glycerin, Stearic Acid, Potassium Hydroxide, Lauric Acid, Propanediol, Parfum (Fragrance), Lauryl Glucoside, Sodium Lauryl Glucose Carboxylate, Nymphaea Alba Root Extract, Centaurea Cyanus Flower Water, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Niacinamide, Arachidyl Alcohol, Hydroxypropyl Methylcellulose Stearoxy Ether, Behenyl Alcohol, Chlorphenesin, Arachidyl Glucoside, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate, Citric Acid, Tetrasodium Edta, Polyquaternium-7Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Take a small amount of La Mousse OFF/ON Foaming Cleanser. Add water and lather into a foam in the palm of your hand.Apply to your face using circular motions.Rinse thoroughly with water, then dry your skin with a clean towel.In the event of contact with eyes, rinse immediately with water.

reviews.headline: could be better
reviews.comments: I like the luxurious part of this but I think you can find better. It did remove my eye makeup, but for the value I think you can find something else. It didn't have a strong scent. The packaging is very clean and aesthetic

reviews.headline: Great Product
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This is a great product! Whenever I use this product I always feel so refreshed. The packaging is so nice and this is a great cost for the quality of this product!

reviews.headline: Left skin feeling dry
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I tried to like it but I felt like my skin was stripped of moisture. My skin just felt really dry after. Good scent but I don't think i'd buy this especially because it's expensive.

reviews.headline: Okayish
reviews.comments: This product was disappointing. The tube was so so small I could only use the product maybe once or twice. I could not get the full effect with this sample size. The scent was too strong, generally cleanser with too much fragrance tend to break me out. I would not recommend for sensitive skin.

reviews.headline: Soft cleanse
reviews.comments: Dior La Mousse OFF/ON feels like a little luxury in a tube. The cream transforms into a soft, airy foam that smells fresh and leaves my skin feeling smooth, hydrated, and clean without stripping. It removes makeup and daily grime easily, and the texture is indulgent. That said, it's heavily fragranced, so it might not suit sensitive skin. Some days I notice a faint film after rinsing, though it hasn't caused breakouts for me. At its price, it's a treat rather than a staple, but for a pampering cleanse that feels spa-like, it delivers.

reviews.headline: Makeup remover
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Very good at taking off makeup. Leaves the skin feeling nice and hydrated. Smells a little minty. It is small for what you're paying for. Packaging is effective.

reviews.headline: Fresh scent  Lux lather
reviews.comments: I have not been compensated for this review.  I am a skincare cleanser junkie so i was intrigued when it came out.  I love this product enough to keep it in my cleanser rotation. Such a beautiful ,smooth ,soft ,foamy texture. Clean fresh scent. I actually just sat back for a moment as i cleansed my face/neck. It truly does take you to a spa type feel. The gentle scent of a clean freshness is so relaxing. It removes fully all my layers of primers,foundations, makeup ,SPF's and several layers of setting sprays. Left my skin feel clean and radiant. Downside is price but since you need only a small amount your tube will last a good long bit. I love this product and will enjoy my future purchases of this product.

reviews.headline: Amazing cleanser
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I love the cleanser, it removes everything even make up so easily!! The smell is so amazing, smells like a spa day. It's refreshing and makes my skin feel so good!!

reviews.headline: Love ❤️
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Such a great gentle cleanser! It doesn't dry you out too much or leave you oily which I love, there is no scent and the packaging is easy to use! I love how it feels on my face! Highly recommend!

reviews.headline: Fragrance!!!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Tried the Dior face wash and honestly, it's a no for me. The formula felt nice, but the fragrance was way too strong for a skincare product. My skin's sensitive, so anything with added scent is a dealbreaker. For the price, I expected something more gentle

reviews.headline: Nice lather
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I only was able to use this product for about a week, as the sample size is very small. However, I was surprised at how little product you need to actually wash your face with this product! It lasted longer than I assumed it would. I do really like the lather on this, it foams up very nicely and makes your face feel so clean without overly drying or stripping your skin. I don't think I would purchase as someone who has sensitive skin, as the cleanser is pretty fragranced. It smells good, similar to a hotel shampoo, but I know my face would probably become irritated if I continued using everyday.

reviews.headline: Love the Lather!
reviews.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review]
The sample I received to test was small, so I can't speak to how this works over time. That being said, for the few days I was able to use it, it seemed like a great product. A little dot really does do a lot, so though the price point may be high, it will last awhile. I found it perfume scented, like I felt like I was using floral perfume infused face wash, and I'm not sure if I like that or not. It lathered really well and didn't get sudsy which made it quick and easy to wash off. My skin felt tight but not dry after using.

reviews.headline: Strong smell, skin felt clean
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This product has a strong scent, so if you're acne prone or sensitive to scent I wouldn't recommend. It gets very bubbly and sudsy which is nice, and it did make my skin feel clean.

reviews.headline: I would definitely repurchase this product!
reviews.comments: This truly made my face feel so clean and fresh! [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] It was a nice way to melt off makeup.  My skin felt super clean after using it.  My skin was also glowing, the ingredients appear to be pretty clean I have sensitive skin and I was okay with it.

reviews.headline: Great for oily skin
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] whenever I get sample face wash, I always like to leave it in my shower so that way I use it when I shower versus using it every day and after using this a few times in the shower, my face feels really good, but it is one of those face washes where once you wash your face, your face is very dry to the touch so it is one of those where I feel the need to put moisturizer on immediately after using, but overall pretty good at removing my make up

reviews.headline: Ehh. Nothing special
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Originally, I expected this to be a lot better considering that it is a high-end brand. The fragrance is just too strong and I can't imagine using this everyday.

reviews.headline: Okay but not amazing.
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] The sample of this was tiny, which meant I got maybe 3 or 4 washes. It foamed nice, cleaned well without stripping, and the scent wasn't overpowering. It wasn't a bad cleanser for sure. But it certainly wasn't anything amazing. I don't think it does any better than my favorite origins cleansers that are half the price. If you want to spend the money on it, go ahead. But I didn't think it was worth the price or was anything special I haven't had or could find for less.

reviews.headline: Works well and smells good!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This product worked very well and had a very cleanly feeling to it. It also smelled quite good and was easy to use. I had the sample size but it still had multiple uses in it.

reviews.headline: Great Product, worth a try
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Dior La Mousse Off/On Cleanser leaves skin fresh and soft—deeply cleanses without drying. A luxury must-have for everyone! Well recommended!

reviews.headline: Very beautiful very Dior
reviews.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I've been using the Dior La Mousse OFF/ON Foaming Cleanser for a few weeks now, and I have some thoughts! As someone who's picky about cleansers I was curious if this luxury product lived up to the hype—and the price.
The packaging is, of course, beautiful—very Dior. It feels fancy on the bathroom counter, and a little goes a long way. The texture comes out as a soft cream but foams up into a rich, cushiony lather when you add water. The scent is strong, which may not work for sensitive skin it also leaves a slight residue if not rinsed thoroughly. It is also Expensive for a cleanser ($50+ range)

faceoff_positive.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] As a busy mom, I don't have time for a 10-step skincare routine — so when I try something new, it has to earn its place. I recently got a sample of Christian Dior's La Mousse OFF/ON Foaming Cleanser, and honestly, I'm pretty impressed!

First of all, the scent is really interesting — it's like a mix of sunscreen and baby powder, which sounds odd but actually feels super nostalgic and comforting. It's not overpowering (which is a huge win for me), even though I usually lean toward fragrance-free skincare. So many luxury brands go overboard with scent, but this one strikes a nice balance. It is effective and does cleanse. 

The texture is soft and creamy, and while it doesn't foam up as much as it does in the ads, it still gives a satisfying lather. What stood out to me is how moisturizing it is — maybe a little too moisturizing for my naturally oily skin, but I can see this being absolutely perfect for dry or combination skin types. It leaves your face feeling clean but not stripped.

At around $56 for the full size, I feel like it's surprisingly affordable for a luxury brand — especially from Dior. It makes me feel pampered without guilt-tripping my budget.

Would my dermatologist give it a thumbs-up? I'm not sure — but for now, this little sample has earned a spot on my bathroom counter. Time will tell, but so far, I'm loving the soft, clean feel it leaves behind!
faceoff_positive.headline: Very good wash!! Luxury!

faceoff_negative.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] The La Mousse Off/On Cleanser has a luxurious feel and delivers on its promise to deeply cleanse the skin. It removes makeup and sunscreen effectively, leaving my face feeling fresh without that tight, stripped feeling. The "ON" part does seem to provide some hydration, and my skin felt smooth and soft afterward.

However, I wouldn't recommend it for those with sensitive skin or fragrance allergies. The scent is quite strong and floral, and the formula includes ingredients like niacinamide and fragrance, which could be irritating for some. Personally, I didn't have a major reaction, but it's definitely not the most gentle option out there.

A decent cleanser if your skin can tolerate it—but not ideal for sensitive or allergy-prone users.
faceoff_negative.headline: Okay
